items.title: As the Arctic Grows Noisier, Narwhals Are Becoming Quieter
items.description: For most of their evolutionary history, narwhals have relied more on sound than sight to survive in the Arctic’s dark icy waters. items.title: ‘Toxic Colonialism’ on the Bay of Bengal
items.description: Every day along the coast of Sitakunda, Bangladesh, the earth recoils without warning. The ground shudders as steel sections, hundreds of feet in length, fall away from the carcasses of former long-distance liners and pummel the mudflats of the world’s largest ship graveyard.
